def: Bear baiting with a dog. Hudibras.
The gathering and examination of sheets preparatory to binding.
A permitted choice; a rhetorical figure in which a thing iscommitted to the decision of one's opponent. [Obs.] Milton.
Having no desire or inclination; indifferent; heedless;spiritless. " A listless unconcern." Thomson.Benumbed with cold, and listless of their gain. Dryden.I was listless, and desponding. Swift.

In a prodigal manner; with profusion of expense; extravagantly;wasteful; profusely; lavishly; as, an estate prodigally dissipated.Nature not bounteous now, but lavish grows; Our paths with flowersshe prodigally strows. Dryden.
Having or showing a just or ready appreciation or perception;as, an appreciative audience.-- Ap*pre"ci*a*tive*ly, adv.
Resembling, or composed of, cinders; full of cinders.
Of or pertaining to a temple. [R.]Solitary, family, and templar devotion. Coleridge.
A drake; the male of Anas boschas.
A green substance, supposed to be the cause of the green colorof the blood in some species of worms. Ray Lankester.
